channel.title: Auto cache downloader trisidiax v3
channel.description:
hey,
when i try to run my trisidiax v3 if it is jarred, it won't auto download to cache.
[b]I get this error in my batch file:[/b]
THIS BATCH IS FOR DEBUGGING THE EXECUTABLE JAR ONLY DOUBLE-CLICK THE "client.jar" TO RUN IT - Generated by: JAR Maker (http://www.goldenstudios.or.id/)
C:\Users\beheerder\Documents\JARMaker\JAR Maker>java -jar client.jar java.util.zip.ZipException: error in opening zip file at java.util.zip.ZipFile.open(Native Method) at java.util.zip.ZipFile.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.util.zip.ZipFile.<init>(Unknown Source) at java.util.zip.ZipFile.<init>(Unknown Source) at Update.unZipFile(Update.java:53) at Update.<init>(Update.java:29) at client.streamLoaderForName(client.java:4918) at client.startUp(client.java:9387) at RSApplet.run(RSApplet.java:33) at client.run(client.java:6303) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
I can play it, but i want it auto downloads cache for my friends.
Please fix this!
Greetings

item.title: Auto cache downloader trisidiax v3
item.dc:creator: @Fiveriverflow Fiveriverflow
item.description:
@Fiveriverflow wrote:

Very Easy To Fix.

First, select all files in ur cache folder and zip em. Dont zip the cache folder or it doesnt work.
Second, make a dropbox account.
third, make a folder called “Public” in ur Dropbox.
fourth, upload that cache to folder “public” in dropbox.
fifth, get the direct download link to that cache and place it in ur autocachedownloader.
sixth, jar and sign your client

You are done!

Read full topic

item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Dylan012:

Do i need to have a folder in the zip file of the cache name or only files of the cache?

Only files in the cache.

hey,

when i try to run my trisidiax v3 if it is jarred, it won’t auto download to cache.

I get this error in my batch file:
